text: Thomas "Tom" Thomas (8 April 1880 - 13 August 1911), was a Welsh boxer. He was the first British middleweight boxing champion. He won the Lonsdale belt in 1909.Sport and the Working Class in Modern Britain, ed. Richard Holt (Manchester; New York: Manchester University Press, 1990.), p. 199 Thomas died of pneumonia in 1911 at age 31. == References == Category:1880 births Category:1911 deaths Category:British boxers Category:Welsh sportspeople
title: Thomas Thomas (boxer)
